templates.form_info: General bucket parameters

templateOptions.label: Bucket Path
templateOptions.placeholder: The virtual bucket path, eg /path/to/bucket

templateOptions.label: Poll Frequency
templateOptions.placeholder: Human readable frequency (eg '10min', '1 day') for how often this harvester is polled

templates.form_info: Settings that are applied when the `test` function is invoked on this bucket

templateOptions.label: Requested Data Objects
templateOptions.placeholder: The desired number of data objects to be returned by the test

templateOptions.label: Max Startup Time (s)
templateOptions.placeholder: The maximum number of seconds to wait for the test to startup

templateOptions.label: Max Run Time (s)
templateOptions.placeholder: The maximum number of seconds to wait for the test to run, after it has started up

templateOptions.label: Max Test Storage Time (s)
templateOptions.placeholder: The maximum time (secs) to keep the test result data

templates.form_info: For advanced users: create an empty Harvester Config that users can build with the form; and configure by writing raw JSON

templateOptions.label: Technology Library Name
templateOptions.placeholder: The path to the technology, eg /app/aleph2/library/harvester.jar

templateOptions.label: Technology Module Name
templateOptions.placeholder: For harvesters with pluggable modules, the path to the module, eg /app/aleph2/library/harvester_module.jar

templateOptions.label: Entry Point Override
templateOptions.placeholder: For harvest modules with multiple entry points, specifies the JVM class to execute, eg com.ikanow.aleph2.harvest.module.Module1EntryPoint

templateOptions.label: Technology Module Name
templateOptions.placeholder: For harvesters that need additional library modules, the path to the module, eg /app/aleph2/library/harvester_module.jar

templateOptions.label: Node rules
templateOptions.placeholder: Comma-separated list of rules determining on which nodes this harvester will run

templateOptions.label: Lock harvester to the same node/set of nodes (recommend leave as true)

building_function.$fn: function(errs, template, curr_obj, all_templates, root_obj, hierarchy, rows, cols) { curr_obj.master_enrichment_type = 'batch'; curr_obj.batch_enrichment_configs = []; return curr_obj.batch_enrichment_configs; }

templates.form_info:
This is a container for a batch enrichment pipeline that will transform incoming objects before writing them into the bucket output.

It has no attributes of its own - instead expand it using the icon and then add the desired attributes from those available.

building_function.$fn: function(errs, template, curr_obj, all_templates, root_obj, hierarchy, rows, cols) { curr_obj.master_enrichment_type = 'streaming'; curr_obj.streaming_enrichment_topology = {}; return curr_obj.streaming_enrichment_topology; }

templates.form_info:
This is a container for a streaming enrichment engine that will transform incoming objects before writing them into the bucket output.

It has no attributes of its own - instead expand it using the icon and then add the desired attributes from those available.
For advanced users: create an empty document schema JSON object that can be Raw JSON to provide the desired functionality

building_function.$fn: function(errs, template, curr_obj, all_templates, root_obj, hierarchy, rows, cols) { var obj = JSON.parse(template.element.form_model.element || '{}'); if (Array.isArray(curr_obj)) curr_obj.push(obj); else if (curr_obj.config) { if (curr_obj.config.enrich_pipeline) curr_obj.config.enrich_pipeline.push(obj); else curr_obj.config = obj; } else for (x in obj) curr_obj[x] = obj[x]; }
function(errs, template, curr_obj, all_templates, root_obj, hierarchy, rows, cols) { curr_obj.analytic_thread = { jobs: [] }; return curr_obj.analytic_thread; }

templates.form_info:
This is a container for the analytic jobs that fill the bucket with data

It has no attributes of its own - instead expand it using the icon and then add the desired attributes from those available.
A streaming or batch analytic job that performs processing on input or stored data.

templateOptions.label: Dependencies
templateOptions.placeholder: A comma-separated list of dependencies on other analytic jobs

templateOptions.label: Technology Library Name
templateOptions.placeholder: The path to the technology, eg /app/aleph2/library/analytic_technology.jar

templateOptions.label: Technology Module Name
templateOptions.placeholder: For analytic technologies with pluggable modules, the path to the module, eg /app/aleph2/library/harvester_module.jar

templateOptions.label: Entry Point Override
templateOptions.placeholder: For analytics modules with multiple entry points, specifies the JVM class to execute, eg com.ikanow.aleph2.harvest.module.Module1EntryPoint

templateOptions.label: Technology Module Name
templateOptions.placeholder: For analytics that need additional library modules, the path to the module, eg /app/aleph2/library/analytic_module_lib.jar

templateOptions.label: Node rules
templateOptions.placeholder: Comma-separated list of rules determining on which nodes this analytic job will run

templates.form_info: A batch analytic job that uses the batch enrichment engine to perform processing on input or stored data.

templateOptions.label: Dependencies
templateOptions.placeholder: A comma-separated list of dependencies on other analytic jobs

templateOptions.label: Technology Module Name
templateOptions.placeholder: For enrichment engines with pluggable modules, the path to the module, eg /app/aleph2/library/batch_enrichment_module.jar

templateOptions.label: Technology Module Name
templateOptions.placeholder: For enrichment engines that need additional library modules, the path to the module, eg /app/aleph2/library/enrichment_module_lib.jar

templateOptions.label: Node rules
templateOptions.placeholder: Comma-separated list of rules determining on which nodes this analytic job will run

templates.form_info: A streaming analytic job that uses the streaming enrichment engine to perform processing on input or stored data.

templateOptions.label: Technology Module Name
templateOptions.placeholder: For enrichment engines with pluggable modules, the path to the module, eg /app/aleph2/library/streaming_enrichment_module.jar

templateOptions.label: Technology Module Name
templateOptions.placeholder: For analytics that need additional library modules, the path to the module, eg /app/aleph2/library/analytic_module_lib.jar

templateOptions.label: Node rules
templateOptions.placeholder: Comma-separated list of rules determining on which nodes this analytic job will run

templates.form_info: For advanced users: create an empty trigger JSON object that can be Raw JSON to provide the desired functionality

templateOptions.label: Trigger Check Schedule
templateOptions.placeholder: Human readable frequency (eg '10min', '1 day') for how often this harvester is polled

building_function.$fn: function(errs, template, curr_obj, all_templates, root_obj, hierarchy, rows, cols) { curr_obj.trigger_config = JSON.parse(template.element.form_model.trigger || '{}'); var pf = template.element.form_model.schedule; curr_obj.trigger_config.schedule = (pf || '').length > 0 ? pf : undefined; }

templates.form_info: Empty JSON object used to configure the global default input configuration for all inputs in this analytic job

building_function.$fn: function(errs, template, curr_obj, all_templates, root_obj, hierarchy, rows, cols) { curr_obj.global_input_config = JSON.parse(template.element.form_model.global_input_config || '{}'); }

templates.form_info: Empty JSON object used to configure an input for this analytic job

building_function.$fn: function(errs, template, curr_obj, all_templates, root_obj, hierarchy, rows, cols) { curr_obj.inputs.push(JSON.parse(template.element.form_model.input || '{}')); }

templates.form_info: Empty JSON object used to configure a single output for this analytic job

building_function.$fn: function(errs, template, curr_obj, all_templates, root_obj, hierarchy, rows, cols) { curr_obj.output = JSON.parse(template.element.form_model.output || '{}'); }
function(errs, template, curr_obj, all_templates, root_obj, hierarchy, rows, cols) { curr_obj.data_schema = {}; return curr_obj.data_schema; }

templates.form_info:
This is a container for the data schema for the different attributes of the stored data

It has no attributes of its own - instead expand it using the icon and then add the desired attributes from those available.
For advanced users: create an empty search index schema JSON object that can be Raw JSON to provide the desired functionality

building_function.$fn: function(errs, template, curr_obj, all_templates, root_obj, hierarchy, rows, cols) { curr_obj.search_index_schema = JSON.parse(template.element.form_model.schema || '{}'); }

templates.form_info: For advanced users: create an empty temporal schema JSON object that can be Raw JSON to provide the desired functionality

building_function.$fn: function(errs, template, curr_obj, all_templates, root_obj, hierarchy, rows, cols) { curr_obj.temporal_schema = JSON.parse(template.element.form_model.schema || '{}'); }

templates.form_info: For advanced users: create an empty columnar schema JSON object that can be Raw JSON to provide the desired functionality

building_function.$fn: function(errs, template, curr_obj, all_templates, root_obj, hierarchy, rows, cols) { curr_obj.columnar_schema = JSON.parse(template.element.form_model.schema || '{}'); }

templates.form_info: For advanced users: create an empty storage schema JSON object that can be Raw JSON to provide the desired functionality

building_function.$fn: function(errs, template, curr_obj, all_templates, root_obj, hierarchy, rows, cols) { curr_obj.storage_schema = JSON.parse(template.element.form_model.schema || '{}'); return curr_obj.storage_schema; }

templates.form_info: For advanced users: create an empty document schema JSON object that can be Raw JSON to provide the desired functionality

building_function.$fn: function(errs, template, curr_obj, all_templates, root_obj, hierarchy, rows, cols) { curr_obj.document_schema = JSON.parse(template.element.form_model.schema || '{}'); return curr_obj.document_schema; }
